Staff & Board - The NewBridge Project What’s On Online Resources Artist Development Practice Makes Practice The Collective Studio Create/Disrupt Space / Hire Gallery NewBridge Books Workshops The Ceramics Room Wood Workshop Darkroom Venue Hire News Artists About About Us Visit Accessibility Ongoing Projects Staff & Board Programme Committee Volunteering Project Proposals Shop Become a Member Account Basket Search Menu × What are you looking for? Enter search term Go! About Us Visit Accessibility Ongoing Projects Staff & Board Programme Committee Volunteering Project Proposals Staff Rebecca Huggan Director rebecca@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Rebecca works 4.5 days a week, usually Monday – Thursday As Director at NewBridge, Rebecca provides overall organisational leadership, strategic development and programme oversight, and oversees operations, finances and fundraising, working alongside artists, communities and partners. She has worked at NewBridge since 2014 and became Director in 2018. She is the Co-Chair of Artist Network North East (formerly CVAN), an advocacy and development organisation for the visual arts who work across the region to support existing activity, effect change, and raise the profile of the North East nationally. She recently co-edited Issue 26 of Art Licks Magazine, and has previously worked on independent projects with Bait and BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art, and at AV Festival, Vane and Project Space Leeds. Frances Stacey Programme Director frances@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Frances works 4.5 days a week, usually Tuesday – Friday Frances provides creative, strategic and operational leadership across NewBridge's artistic programmes, working closely with the Director and wider staff team. Delivering a programme that is artist-led and experimental in its approach, produced with and for artists and local communities. She previously worked as a Producer and Acting Head of Programme at Collective, Edinburgh; was a co-founder of artist led space Rhubaba Gallery and Studios, Edinburgh; a trustee for sex-worker rights organisation Scot-Pep; and is part of the Feminism Art Maintenance group, an international research project exploring perspectives on womxns organising. Dan Russell Artist Development Programmer dan@thenewbridgeproject.com he/him Dan works 4 days a week, usually Tuesday – Friday Dan helps oversee the Collective Studio and Practice Makes Practice. He is an artist who usually works with other people across visual art, music, design and socially-engaged projects. He has been involved in running several artist-led collectives, project spaces and studios in Manchester and is most interested in longer-term, process-led ways of working. Ruby Glover Building & People Manager ruby@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Ruby works 4.5 days a week, usually Monday – Thursday Ruby manages the studios and building and is the first point of contact for any hire enquiries. She also provides organisational and administrative support across NewBridge membership and volunteer programmes. Ruby worked in people-focused and facility management positions for a number of years prior to joining the NewBridge team in 2020. She is a graduate in Photography and continues to develop her practice outside of her role at NewBridge. Hannah Kirkham For Solidarity Project Manager hannah@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Hannah works 3 days a week, usually Wednesday – Friday Hannah works to support the network of initiatives and organisations who are part of our ongoing For Solidarity project. She runs regular events and promotes the community work done locally that exists outside of restrictive economic models. She has been a member of NewBridge for 7 years and, amongst other creative projects, hand-crafts clothing using organic and recycled fabrics under the name Scout & Rae Izzy Finch Project Manager izzy@thenewbridgeproject.com she/they Izzy works 4 days a week, usually Tuesday – Friday Izzy is Create/Disrupt Project Manager. Izzy works with diverse communities to engage people in artistic & creative experiences. As someone whose path to becoming an arts worker was defined by quality arts participation and experiences rather than institutional training, she is committed to promoting and facilitating this right for artists from all backgrounds and cultural perspectives. Their practice is rooted in values of community, belonging and creating a space for historically marginalised people to be perceived as valuable knowledge holders. Izzy is a freelance EDI and Belonging Specialist, Researcher and Writer and also works for GemArts. Niamh Cunningham Freelance Bookkeeper finance@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Niamh works with us a few days a month on a freelance basis, and is usually in the office on Wednesday Niamh is a self-employed bookkeeper, working principally for charities in Newcastle, including Creativity Culture & Education, Fertile Ground Dance Ltd and Ballet Lorent. She also acts as trustee and treasurer for two other charities. She works with us one day a week to keep our finances in order. Maya Wallis Bookshop and Reading Room Producer bookshop@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Maya works 3 days a week, usually Wednesday – Friday Maya oversees the day to day running of both sites, which includes researching stock and connecting with independent publishers. She programmes events across both NewBridge Books and the Reading Room, with a focus on an artist-led programme that showcases art-writing, experimental publishing, and knowledge sharing. Maya is also an artist whose practice is routed in blending writing and visual arts into some kind of ‘aesthetic fiction’. She co-runs Albion Row Studios alongside Hannah Christy and Sabina Sallis. Nat Loftus Development & Reporting Manager nat@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Nat works 3 days a week, usually Tuesday - Thursday Nat works closely with the Director, our funders, and partners to monitor and evaluate NewBridge’s development, activities, and impact to ensure the effective delivery of our projects. Nat also plays a key role in managing fundraising and reporting efforts across the organisation, supporting the continued success of our programmes. Nat brings a rich background in trusts fundraising and grant-making for charities and arts organisations. As both an artist and musician, Nat offers a unique creative perspective that resonates with NewBridge’s ethos. Izaak Gledhill Youth Programme Producer izaak@thenewbridgeproject.com he/him Izaak works 2 days a week, Monday & Wednesday Izaak oversees the planning, management and delivery of the Youth Programme across development, operations, administration and communication. Working closely with Lib and Raffa to design an engaging programme of activities that not only meets the needs of young people but has their voice and vision at its centre. Izaak is also an experienced facilitator and theatre maker who is passionate about championing the voices of LGBTQIA+ communities. Lib Hodes Youth Worker lib@thenewbridgeproject.com they/them Lib works 2 days a week, Monday & Wednesday Lib works between The NewBridge Project and Dwellbeing Shieldfield to deliver meaningful youth activity for children and young people as part of the Shieldfield Youth Programme. This involves getting out and about meeting young people and their families, running weekly activities, monthly skills workshops, trips, and events. Lib is an artist and performance maker from Newcastle, who joined the NewBridge team in July 2023 as a Sessional Youth Worker, having first met the Shieldfield Youth Programme young people whilst working with them as an artist for Band Camp in 2022. Alongside their work at NewBridge, Lib works freelance as a facilitator and artist in various settings including running Little Builders at The Farrell Centre. Rafael Bagott Sessional Youth Worker rafael@thenewbridgeproject.com he/him Rafael works 2 days a week, Monday & Wednesday Rafael supports the Shieldfield Youth Programme, working with Izaak and Lib to lead sessions. He also works for Skimstone Arts, who are based in our building, as Project Youth Support Co-ordinator. He has a background in Marine Biology, and is passionate about research, conservation, and sharing his knowledge with the public. Meaghan Stewart Communications Producer comms@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Meaghan works 4 days a week, usually Tuesday – Friday Meaghan leads and supports all communications efforts at The NewBridge Project, working across print media, the website, social media, and press outreach. She ensures that NewBridge's diverse and exciting programmes reach and inspire new and existing audiences. Meaghan brings a wealth of experience to the role, with marketing and communications experience in both the public and private sectors prior to joining The NewBridge Project. Jesse Howarth Admin and Front of House Assistant admin@thenewbridgeproject.com she/her Jesse works 4 days a week, every other Mon/Saturday, and usually Wednesday – Friday Jesse provides administrative and practical support across the whole team, working within all our programmes, systems and communications. The front-of-house component of her role means you will often find Jesse in the bookshop or gallery spaces, welcoming visitors and acting as a point of contact for enquiries. Jesse is also an artist and writer. She tells stories, sometimes making images and objects to perform with. Jackie Wood Communities Facilitator Jackie works weekly for Monday Coffee Morning and once a month for the Saturday Social. As one of our Communities Facilitators, Jackie supports the running of our Coffee Mornings and Saturday Socials. Through this she welcomes visitors to our building and builds relationships with our communities. As part of her role she is responsible for setting up, delivering and evaluating our regular activity. Jackie is an artist, was a previous member of our Collective Studio develelopment programme, and was the founder of our coffee mornings. She also runs popular workshop sessions as part of our Memory Cafe sessions in partnership with Forum Cafe. Hana Azahed Communities Facilitator Hana works weekly for Monday Coffee Morning and once a month for the Saturday Social. As one of our Communities Facilitators, Hana supports the running of our Coffee Mornings and Saturday Socials. Through this she welcomes visitors to our building and builds relationships with our communities. As part of her role she is responsible for setting up, delivering and evaluating our regular activity. Hana is a chef, artist and Shieldfield resident. She recently undertook a 6-month residency with NewBridge where she shared cultures from her home, Ghadamas, a Unesco World Heritage Site, through cooking amazing Libyan food, and working in collaboration with the Shieldfield Youth Programme and Ceramics studio. The NewBridge Project is supported by Arts Council England, Newcastle Culture Investment Fund, Newcastle University and the North East Combined Authority. About The NewBridge Project is an artist studio, gallery and bookshop, hosting a programme of exhibitions and events. ©The NewBridge Project 2025 Cookies and Privacy Policy Shop Terms & Conditions Brand by Keano Anton | Website by Supanaught Visit The Shieldfield Centre 4-8 Clarence Walk (via Stoddart Street) Newcastle upon Tyne NE2 1AL The Gallery and NewBridge Books are open: Wednesday – 1pm – 5pm Thursday, Friday and Saturday –  12pm – 5pm For more information on visiting our space, please see our Visit page or our Accessibility page. Contact Telephone: 07708 195 800 Email: admin@thenewbridgeproject.com Facebook: thenewbridgeproject Instagram: @newbridgeproject Join our mailing list × Login Username Password Remember Me Lost your password? Forgotten Password Cancel ×

About Us - Newberry Group Skip to content Employee Login Careers Employee Login Careers Employee Login Careers Employee Login Careers About Us Why Newberry Group Services Contact Us About Us Why Newberry Group Services Contact Us About Us Helping Organizations Achieve Peak-Performance Levels At Newberry Group, we make it possible for public sector clients to confidently operate at full throttle in order to achieve the best results. When you work with us, you can expect our professionals to become a true member of your team and fully support your mission with custom processes, services, and solutions. Simply put, as our client we’ll help your organization reach operational success faster and with less hurdles to overcome—no matter your objectives. As a small but mighty business, we’re able to produce big results because we pride ourselves on having agile mindsets, a flexible yet effective delivery approach, and direct involvement in your daily operations. Our leadership team has a strong record of individual accomplishments in both corporate and government service, and this cross-sector leverage of public and private best practices helps us strengthen your organization while spearheading our growth. Our Approach The Newberry Group management philosophy focuses on ensuring customer satisfaction by emphasizing exceptional performance, transparent management, and the diligent identification of risks as they arise. Our project managers (PMs) have direct reach-back capability to our executive team to support complex or critical risks. We work together and with your team to guarantee rapid problem resolutions, so any issues that may arise do not become a crisis for your organization in the future. We Are Your Partner Using our expertise and authenticity, we strive to form a trusted partner relationship with your organization. By building structured collaboration into the delivery of requested services, we’re able to set the stage for continued cooperation beyond the timeframe of a specific engagement. Engaging key stakeholders at the beginning of the project—including team leads, PMs, employees, executive sponsors, and other stakeholders across your organization—enables the development of collaborative solutions that meet the needs of your organization both internally and externally. The benefits to this approach include achieving early and consistently strong buy-in from critical stakeholders on processes and key deliverables, and to use the right resources, at the right time, on the right tasks. Undeniable Processes, Proven Results Newberry Group is appraised at Level 3 of the CMMI Institute’s Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI)®. With over 30 years of serving as a global leader in organizational advancement across a variety of locations and industries, CMMI is an integrated set of best practices that enables organizations, such as Newberry Group, to improve the performance of key business processes. This level of appraisal confirms that our processes are performed and managed in accordance with a recorded organizational level process description. The CMMI enables us to enhance execution across a range of critical business capabilities, including service excellence, workforce management, data management, and cybersecurity. Professional services SECURITY COMPLIANCE Peak Performance is Our Promise to You Adopting a true partnership approach, we work alongside our customers with 100% transparency. The result is an entrepreneurial, customer-centered focus that sets us apart in our industry. We are not your typical small business contractor. The strength of our company is a direct reflection of our highly skilled, certified, and talented teams. Our core values are Integrity, Innovation, and Trust. These are at the forefront of everything we do. Creating Value for Our Clients By exploring next practices in technologies and services we bring technical innovation to the forefront of our brand. Employees Invested in Your Success Newberry Group employees are driven to bring complete transparency, professional excellence, and uncompromised integrity to every project, challenge, and service touchpoint. Our signature customer service experience is something each of us takes pride in. Experience the Newberry Group Difference Meet Our Management Team We are headquartered in St. Charles, Missouri. We employ a nationwide network of technical and consulting professionals geographically dispersed throughout the United States. Together, we help public sector agencies across the country unlock the true, often untapped, power of technology and build unmistakable value for their organizations. Christopher J. Steinbach President & Chief Executive Officer Christopher J. ABOUT US HOME Partners FESTIVALS About ABOUT US PHOTOS Firehouse Gallery FIREHOUSE GALLERY TOURISM CENTER More HOME Partners FESTIVALS About ABOUT US PHOTOS Firehouse Gallery FIREHOUSE GALLERY TOURISM CENTER HOME Partners FESTIVALS About ABOUT US PHOTOS Firehouse Gallery FIREHOUSE GALLERY TOURISM CENTER About Newberry Main Street Organization Our History Newberry, Florida has gone through many changes since its' incorporation. We were officially named in 1894 when our first post office was built. As we evolved into a mining town for phosphate industries we also grew as a community. More local businesses were established like drug stores, saloons and sawmills. Some of these early buildings are still used and seen in our town today. With the initiative of hard working volunteers who have a passion to see Newberry grow and thrive, Newberry Main Street Organization (NMSO) was officially established in 2006. We are a non-profit organization that receives grants from the state as well as  sponsorships from the public. We strive to educate the public on our history, provide fun activities for the community, advocate to protect our historical footprint and help Main Street businesses thrive. NMSO enjoys networking with our local businesses and citizens, getting feedback on how we can continue to help the community and staying in touch with our hometown feel. Newberry Main Street Organization is a member of the State Florida Main Street, as well as the National Main Street Organization. Learn more about Newberry's history... In the spring of 2025, students from UF's historic preservation program along with the guidance of Dr. Clarissa Carr took. a deep dive into Newberry history and locations around town.  You can. find more information.on the website they created here . We would like to sincerely thank and recognize Dr.  Carr and her students for their hard  work and dedication. Your work is not only appreciated, but a valuable asset to Newberry and NMSO! Join the fun! Volunteer! Generate Excitement! Generate Excitement! We are always looking for volunteers who want to be involved with the Newberry Main Street Organization! Let us know if you are interested! Please email or use the Contact section on our home page. executivedir.nmsoinfo@gmail.com Generate Excitement! Generate Excitement! Generate Excitement! Bring your special talents to our town! If you have interest in making YOUR town a better place and working together community partners, please consider becoming a NMSO Partner or Sponsor. Overview Join Us Renew Your Membership Donate Partner With Us Job Opportunities English Español Member Login Donate Search About Who We Are Main Street America has been helping strengthen and reenergize downtowns and neighborhood commercial districts for more than 45 years. Explore This Section Who We Are How We Work Partner Collaborations Our Supporters Our Team Contact Us Who We Are How We Work Partner Collaborations Our Supporters Our Team Contact Us Atlanta, Georgia © Main Street America WE ARE MAIN STREET Main Street America ( MSA ) leads an inclusive, impact-driven movement dedicated to reenergizing and strengthening older and historic downtowns and neighborhood commercial districts through place-based economic development and community preservation. We work in collaboration with thousands of local partners and grassroots leaders across the nation who share our commitment to advancing shared prosperity, creating resilient economies, and improving quality of life. Main Street America was founded in 1980 as the National Main Street Center®, a program of the National Trust for Historic Preservation. Over the past 40 years the MSA network has helped to generate over $ 115 . 27 billion in local reinvestment, rehab 345 , 801 buildings, create 815 , 894 new jobs, and start 181 , 647 new businesses in over 2 , 000 communities. Our History Main Street America has been helping reenergize and strengthen communities since 1977 . Mary Means, the founder of Main Street (left) © The National Trust for Historic Preservation Link to Our History Our Strategic Plan Main Street America’s new Strategic Plan will guide our work for the next 5 – 10 years, building on our legacy and core purpose. Link to Our Strategic Plan Our Team Our team is comprised of highly talented and passionate individuals dedicated to place-based economic development. Atlanta, Georgia © Main Street America Link to Our Team Job Opportunities Explore opportunities to join our team of highly skilled and dedicated individuals committed to place-based economic development. Main Street America team at the 2022 Main Street Now Conference in Richmond, Virginia. © Main Street America Link to Job Opportunities We Believe Main Streets Are for Everyone Everyone should have access to an inclusive and resilient Main Street – a place that has a thriving local economy, is distinctive and rich in character, and features welcoming spaces and diverse businesses for residents and visitors alike. Main Street America models and champions this vision through our actions and programs. Learn more about our vision and steps we are taking to shape an inclusive future .
